Posted By: jsttu (7/9/2011 10:56:44 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
This + [Energy Chamber](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Energy Chamber) won me a game once.   
  
My friend was so busy with other removal of supposed *good* cards like [Master of Etherium](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Master of Etherium), [Steel Overseer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Steel Overseer) and [Master Transmuter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Master Transmuter) he neglected to see the 7/9 Ornithopter chilling on the side of my board.   
  
That is, until he ran out of removal and then got beat to death with it.
posts.html:
This + Energy Chamber won me a game once.

My friend was so busy with other removal of supposed good cards like Master of Etherium, Steel Overseer and Master Transmuter he neglected to see the 7/9 Ornithopter chilling on the side of my board.

That is, until he ran out of removal and then got beat to death with it.

Posted By: BlackAlbino (5/2/2011 7:41:08 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: So i was playing goblins against this guy and had a playset of ornithopters to feed [Kuldotha Rebirth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kuldotha Rebirth). After bringing him to 10 life, he [Pyroclasm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pyroclasm)ed and wiped my board away. I quickly recovered, brought him to 2 life, then a [Slagstorm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Slagstorm) showed up and ruined my board again. Getting dangerously close to that point where aggro decks have no choice but to lose, I became desperate. The solution came in the form of this little guycombined with a [contested war zone](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=contested war zone). My opponent quickly conceded before facing a slow death by ornithopter.
posts.html:
So i was playing goblins against this guy and had a playset of ornithopters to feed Kuldotha Rebirth. After bringing him to 10 life, he Pyroclasmed and wiped my board away. I quickly recovered, brought him to 2 life, then a Slagstorm showed up and ruined my board again. Getting dangerously close to that point where aggro decks have no choice but to lose, I became desperate. The solution came in the form of this little guycombined with a contested war zone. My opponent quickly conceded before facing a slow death by ornithopter.
